archetype_name: Family Skillet Curries & Stir-Fries (Medium Heat, 15–30, Intermediate)
name: Szechuan Pepper Beef & Green Bean Stir-Fry with Jasmine Rice
description: Thin-sliced beef and crisp green beans in a soy-chili glaze finished with szechuan pepper oil, served over fluffy jasmine rice. Medium heat and weeknight-fast on the stovetop.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear; drain.
Thinly slice 500 g beef across the grain.
Trim 300 g green beans; cut in half.
Slice 1 bell pepper and 1 onion into thin strips.
Mince 3 cloves garlic; slice 2 spring onion.
In a bowl, whisk 3 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 tbsp brown sugar, 1–2 tsp sriracha, and 1–2 tsp szechuan pepper oil.
Toss sliced beef with 2 tsp cornflour and a pinch of salt.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Add rinsed jasmine rice to a pot with 2 1/2 cups water and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer 12–15 minutes until tender. Keep covered off heat.
Heat a large skillet or wok over high heat. Add 1 tbsp canola oil.
Stir-fry green beans 2 minutes until bright and slightly blistered. Add a pinch of salt, then transfer to a plate.
Add 1 tbsp canola oil to the skillet. Sear beef in a single layer 2–3 minutes, flipping once, until just browned (work in batches if needed).
Add sliced onion and bell pepper; stir-fry 2 minutes until starting to soften.
Add minced garlic; stir 30 seconds until fragrant.
Return green beans to the pan. Pour in the soy-chili sauce; toss 1–2 minutes until glossy and slightly thickened. Adjust heat with extra sriracha if desired.
Taste and season with a pinch of black pepper and salt if needed.
Fluff rice. Serve stir-fry over rice and top with sliced spring onion.
